message.content:
cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper presents a constraint programming approach for solving a queueing control problem, which involves optimizing worker switching policies to minimize customer waiting time while ensuring sufficient staffing in the back room. This problem is related to several sub-fields of computer science, including artificial intelligence (cs.AI) for the optimization aspect, robotics (cs.RO) for the application to facility operations, data structures (cs.DS) for the modeling of the queueing system, machine learning (cs.LG) for the use of heuristic algorithms, and systems and control (cs.SY) for the control aspect of the problem. However, given the focus on optimization and constraint programming, cs.AI and cs.RO are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.DS, cs.LG, and cs.SY.
